adding Produces a result array with one more dimension than a given source array.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The adddim operator adds a stub, integer dimension to an array to increase its dimensionality by 1. The datatype of the new dimension is int64. The size of the new dimension is 1.

The cardinality of the added dimension is limited to 1â€”that is, you can only increase a 1-dimensional array to 2 dimensions, a 2-dimensional array to 3 dimensions, and so on. If you need more redimensioning capabilities, use the operator.
SciDB does not have an analogous operator for adding an attribute. To add an attribute to an array, use the operator.

informalexample.para: This example creates a 2-dimensional array from 1-dimensional arrays.

step.para: Use adddim to add a dimension to both vectors and then concatenate them. The result will have two dimensions:--afl concat(adddim(vector0,x),adddim(vector1,y)); --chunkify=yes --output-format=auto
